description.narrative: Commitments and resources from the private sector are mobilized and leveraged for child rights programming and advocacy., which contributes to Private Sector Engagement, Private Sector Fundraising. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All programme components supported through communication, advocacy and partnerships and improved accountability for results

sector.narrative: Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)

description.narrative: External to government sector External to general government sector

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in South Africa (Progress and Challenges)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
"2016 South Africa: Conducting a Rapid Assessment of MomConnect Project from September 2011 to date in eThekwini and Umgungundlovu districts KwaZulu-Natal"
South Africa 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Commitments and resources from the private sector are mobilized and leveraged for child rights programming and advocacy.

description.narrative: An increasing number of companies, private sector influencers and High Net Worth Individuals were mobilized to leverage and advocate for UNICEF South Africa's priority (advocacy) issues with peers, their customers, the broader business community or other influencers or decision-makers. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:07/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of inadequate use of UNICEF name and logo within the existing and new corporate partnerships
